content.description: Balancy slab moves to gain crack and headwall.

Scramble up the boulders at the base of the climb to begin this striking wide hands crack. Sink your fists deep into the crack and jam your way upward. Slightly overhanging in nature, the lower section of the crack is bomber. Continue up with the crack growing ever so slightly wider until the top section begs to spit you out. Plentiful holds on the face throughout can be utilized for substantially easier climbing. Extremely enjoyable climbing while unfortunately being rather short. The crack takes hands to fist-sized gear and larger pieces at the top. It is possible to scramble up the surrounding boulders to access the anchors for a top rope or to downclimb.
content.location: Located on the east face of the Entrance Boulder in a corridor, around the corner from Welcome to Pinnacles.

content.description: Climb a dirty, left-slanting finger crack then transition to a dirty, right-slanting hand crack and finish with a short section of face climbing past one bolt to anchors. Despite the name the climbing is decent and the quality might improve with more traffic.
content.location:
Just left of

Welcome to the Pinnacles

.

climbs.name: Chimed
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Lisa Guindon, September 2003

content.description: Start up a wide slanting crack, transition to twin cracks with a bush and finish up featured face past a bolt to anchors.
content.location:
Just around and right from

Welcome to the Pinnacles

.
